saltr

Class SLTSaltr

  • java.lang.Object
    • saltr.SLTSaltr

  • public class SLTSaltr
extends java.lang.Object
    The entry point to SDK, and the main class, used to send and receive data from Saltr.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SLTSaltr

        public SLTSaltr(java.lang.String clientKey,
        java.lang.String deviceId,
        boolean useCache,
        android.content.ContextWrapper contextWrapper)
        Initializes a new instance of the SLTSaltr class.
        Parameters:
        clientKey - Client key.
        deviceId - Device identifier.
        useCache - If set to true use cache. If not specified defaults to true
        contextWrapper - This can be the reference of activity where SDK is initialized.

    • Method Detail

      • setRequestIdleTimeout

        public void setRequestIdleTimeout(int requestIdleTimeout)
        Sets the request idle timeout. If a URL request takes more than timeout to complete, it would be canceled.
        Parameters:
        requestIdleTimeout - the request idle timeout in milliseconds.

      • setRepository

        public void setRepository(ISLTRepository repository)
        Sets the repository used by this instance. An appropriate repository is already set by a constructor, so you will need this only if you want to implement and use your own custom repository (ISLTRepository).
        Parameters:
        repository - to set.

      • setUseNoLevels

        public void setUseNoLevels(java.lang.Boolean useNoLevels)
        Sets a value indicating whether the application does not use levels.
        Parameters:
        useNoLevels - true if levels are not used; otherwise, false.

      • setUseNoFeatures

        public void setUseNoFeatures(java.lang.Boolean useNoFeatures)
        Sets a value indicating whether the application does not use features.
        Parameters:
        useNoFeatures - true if features are not used, otherwise, false.

      • setDevMode

        public void setDevMode(java.lang.Boolean devMode)
        Sets a value indicating weather this SLTSaltr should operate in dev(developer) mode.

        In this mode client data(e.g. developer defined features) will be synced with Saltr, once, after successful connect(SLTIDataHandler, Object, Object) call.

        Parameters:
        devMode - true to enable; false to disable.

      • setAutoRegisterDevice

        public void setAutoRegisterDevice(boolean autoRegisterDevice)
        Sets a value indicating whether device registratioon dialog should be automaticaly shown in dev mode devMode, after successful call, if the device was not registered already.
        Parameters:
        autoRegisterDevice -

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a level by its global index in all levels.

      • getPackByLevelGlobalIndex

        public SLTLevelPack getPackByLevelGlobalIndex(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the level in all levels.
        Returns:
        the level pack that contains the level with given global index in all levels.

      • getActiveFeatureTokens

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getActiveFeatureTokens()
        Returns:
        a list of tokens(unique identifiers) of all features, active in Saltr.

      • getFeatureProperties

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getFeatureProperties(java.lang.String token)
        Gets the properties of the feature specified by the token. If a feature is set to be required and is not active in, or cannot be retrieved from, Saltr, the properties will be retrieved from default developer defined features.
        Parameters:
        token - The feature token.
        Returns:
        the properties of the feature.

      • importLevels

        public void importLevels(java.lang.String path)
        Imports the level data from local files, that can be downloaded from Saltr. If your application is using levels, this must be called before calling start(), otherwise has no effect.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to level packs in Resources folder. If not specified the SLTConfig.LOCAL_LEVELPACK_PACKAGE_URL will be used.

      • defineFeature

        public void defineFeature(java.lang.String token,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties,
                 boolean required)
        Defines a feature SLTFeature
        Parameters:
        token - Token - a unique identifier for the feature.
        properties - A Map of properties, that should be of "JSON friendly" data types (String, Integer, Double, Map, List, etc.). To represent color use standard HTML format: "#RRGGBB"
        required - If set to true feature is required(see getFeatureProperties(java.lang.String)). false by default.

      • start

        public void start()
        Checks if everything is initialized properly and starts the instance.

        After this call you can access application data (levels, features), and establish connection with the server.

      • connect

        public void connect(SLTIDataHandler appDataHandler,
           java.lang.Object basicProperties,
           java.lang.Object customProperties)
        Establishes connection to the server and updates application data(levels, features and experiments).

        After connecting successfully you can load level content from server with loadLevelContent(saltr.game.SLTLevel, boolean, SLTIDataHandler) .

        Parameters:
        appDataHandler - Instance of class that implements SLTIDataHandler interface.
        basicProperties - (Optional)Basic properties. Same as in addProperties(Object, Object).
        customProperties - (Optional)Basic properties. Same as in addProperties(Object, Object).

      • loadLevelContent

        public void loadLevelContent(SLTLevel sltLevel,
                    boolean useCache,
                    SLTIDataHandler levelDataHandler)
        Loads the content(boards and properties) of the level.

        Contents may be loaded from server, cache, or local level data(importLevels(String)).

        Parameters:
        sltLevel - The level, contents of which will be updated.
        useCache - If set to false cached level data will be ignored, forcing content to be loaded from server or local data if connection is not established. true by default.
        levelDataHandler - Instance of class that implements SLTIDataHandler interface.

      • addProperties

        public void addProperties(java.lang.Object basicProperties,
                 java.lang.Object customProperties)
        Method called to send user specific information to SALTR web app.
        Parameters:
        basicProperties - Basic information about user. More information about properties you can find on https://saltr.com/docs#/mobile
        customProperties - Custom information about user. More information about properties you can find on https://saltr.com/docs#/mobile

      • registerDevice

        public void registerDevice()
        Opens the device registration dialog. Can be called after start() only.
